snippet: Though wholesale stockpiles shrank 0.5 percent in May, a steady increase in sales could drive economic growth as companies restock later this year.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports wholesale stockpiles shrank 0.5 percent in May, following 0.1 percent decline in April; sales increased 1.6 percent and 0.7 percent in April; steady increase in sales could drive economic growth as companies restock.
lead_paragraph: Though wholesale stockpiles shrank 0.5 percent in May, a steady increase in sales could drive economic growth as companies restock later this year.

headline.main: Shrinking Stockpiles Hint at Future Economic Growth
headline.print_headline: Shrinking Stockpiles Hint At Future Economic Growth
